condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Los niños pequeños, las niñas, los niños y los adolescentes tienen acceso a un aprendizaje temprano y a resultados de aprendizaje inclusivos y basados en la igualdad de género, en un ambiente seguro y limpio en línea con los enfoques de desarrollo del niño en la primera infancia y las escuelas amigas de los niños.

description.narrative: UNICEF CO support the Government for the roll out of a distance learning programme during the COVID-19 emergency situation, but is faced with severe limitations in terms of financing and Human Resources. The work continues to advocate for more evidence generation in the education sector and for improving the digitalization of the education sector. . | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/12/2019

title.narrative: A campaign on sexual education launched.
An analysis of the CFS implementation in target schools conducted.
The Out of School Children (OOSC) study validated.
A test tool developed to measure learning outcome in reading and mathematics in line with Covid-19 response..
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Number of students who received learning materials supported by UNICEF.
A platform for distance learning established through radio and/or TV.
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
# of countries with effective education systems for early learning outcomes
A joint review of the OOSC Study findings to address the challenges of Out of School Children with Government is made
